intro: Gelasia villosa, commonly known as the hairy gelasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Gelasia villosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
